name: Fall Buddha Bowl with Quinoa
description: This vegan buddha bowl with quinoa, pumpkin, and BBQ tempeh is not only super delicious but also packed with nutrients! It's topped with a creamy cashew sauce that makes it even healthier!
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup sprouts ((I used alfalfa, beetroot, and leek sprouts))
1/2 cup cashews (If you want to make it easier for your blender soak them in water for about 15 minutes.)
1/2 cup unsweetend almond or soy milk

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the quinoa according to the instructions on the package. Place a large pot of water on the stove, add a pinch of salt, and wait a few minutes for the water to boil. Place the Brussels sprouts in the boiling water and cook them for about 12-15 minutes. Cut the Hokkaido squash into cubes and cook them for 8-10 minutes.

Place the Brussels sprouts in the boiling water and cook them for about 12-15 minutes. Cut the Hokkaido squash into cubes and cook them for 8-10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the beetroot into thin slices. Peel the carrots and create julienne strips by using a spiral slicer.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut the beetroot into thin slices. Peel the carrots and create julienne strips by using a spiral slicer.

recipeInstructions.text: Make the sauce: Place all ingredients into a blender and process until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the sauce: Place all ingredients into a blender and process until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the tempeh into small cubes. In a medium pan, heat some olive oil and sauté the onion for about 2-3 minutes until it's translucent. Then add the tempeh, the BBQ sauce, the water, the soy sauce, the paprika powder, salt, pepper, and if using the liquid smoke. Cook for 5-7 minutes until the marinade is all soaked up and the tempeh becomes lightly brown and crispy.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the cooked Hokkaido squash, the Brussels sprouts, the carrots, the beet, and the quinoa in a big bowl. In a small pan, heat the cashew sauce for about 2 minutes. If it becomes to thick, add another splash of milk.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the sauce over the buddha bowl and sprinkle with sprouts and pumpkin seeds.
